form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Scott of Florida introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to include subjection to a foreign intelligence security law as a ground of inadmissibility and deportability.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Preventing Intelligence Gathering from Foreign Adversaries Act.

section.header: Subjection to foreign intelligence security law as grounds of inadmissibility and deportability

subsection.text: Section 212(a)(3) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(3)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Subjection to foreign intelligence security law
subparagraph.text: Any alien who is subject to a law of any foreign country that requires such alien to provide access to, cooperation with, or support for, the intelligence-gathering activities or operations of such county is inadmissible.

subsection.text: Section 237(a)(4) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1227(a)(4)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.header: Subjection to foreign intelligence security law
subparagraph.text: Any alien who is subject to a law of any foreign country that requires such alien to provide access to, cooperation with, or support for, the intelligence-gathering activities or operations of such county is deportable.
